intro: Glochidion lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf glabrous wood vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
